content: the woodland crochet pumpkin pattern is a fun quick way to make organic-looking crochet pumpkins using a highly textured but easy crochet stitch this project works up quickly you will be able to make crochet pumpkins in any size using this one pattern best of all this pdf crochet pattern is great for stash busting and your crochet pumpkins will look great in any color with instructions on how to change the size of your pumpkins as well as the ability to use any yarn weight you prefer you ll have your own crochet pumpkin patch in no time with a final embellishment for the stem being your own choice this crochet pumpkin will be easy to fit into your specific style of home decoration i used a part of a stick to keep with the organic feel but you could use a cinnamon stick crochet a stem or anything else you can think of **skill level ** easy/medium to advanced beginner- this crochet pumpkin pattern is relatively easy to follow along with you will need to know how to chain slip_stitch and half_double_crochet additionally you ll need to know how to seam two sides together using a tapestry needle as well as identify sides of stitches to weave in and out of this pdf crochet pattern includes several photos to help through the hardest part - the seaming the cinching and creating the ribs of the pumpkin **pattern includes ** 1 full version pdf with photo tutorial for all the steps to finish the pumpkin such as seaming cinching stuffing and creating the ribs 2 printer friendly pdf with only one picture and 4 pages to save ink **terms used ** us standard pattern is written in english **size ** 16 inches around by 3 5 inches high as written in the pattern it is easy to customize the size to however you prefer **materials required ** medium 4 weight yarn of your choice in any color you prefer you will need approximately 2 oz/57g/105 yards yarn used dark green pumpkin - lion brand basic stitch in olive white pumpkin - yarn bee soft and sleek in ivory **you will also need ** stuffing to stuff the pumpkin optional something to include for the stem i used a small piece of stick you can use a cinnamon stick crochet one etc **tools ** 5 mm h-8 hook tapestry needle scissors i hope you enjoy creating little pumpkins i would love to see your growing pumpkin patch so be sure to tag @theloopholefoxcrochet or #theloopholefoxcrochet on your instagram posts so i can show you some love i hope you love your woodland crochet pumpkins as much as i love mine enjoy
